it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.model.Map

  • public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
    this class represents the map or board of the actual game

      • getCell

        public Cell getCell(int x,
                    int y)
        Returns the reference of a selected cell
        Parameters:
        x - X-coordinate of the cell
        y - Y-coordinate of the cell
        Returns:
        cell reference (or null in case of out of bound coordinates or missing cell)

      • getCell

        public Cell getCell(Point p)
        Returns the reference of a selected cell
        Parameters:
        p - Point with X and Y coordinates of the cell
        Returns:
        Cell in the correct position, or null in case of out of bound coordinates or missing cell

      • getCellPosition

        public Point getCellPosition(Cell c)
        Gives a point containing the coordinates of a cell
        Parameters:
        c - Requested cell
        Returns:
        Point with X and Y coordinates of the cell in the map

      • jsonDeserialize

        public static Map jsonDeserialize(int mapNumber)
        Deserialize one of the four maps
        Parameters:
        mapNumber - 1 to 4, the number of the map
        Returns:
        the deserialized map or null if mapNumber it's not in the range

      • jsonDeserialize

        public static Map jsonDeserialize(java.lang.String pathJsonFile)
                           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Deserializes the JSON config file and loads the data in the matrix
        Parameters:
        pathJsonFile - JSON map config file
        Returns:
        Map class with its matrix correctly initialized according to the json file's content
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If there is a problem accessing the file

                                                    Map map,
                                                    Direction dir)
        Return the visible players from the viewer players in a cardinal direction, it doesn't care about walls
        Parameters:
        viewer - the one who is looking
        map - the map on which we are looking for
        dir - the cardinal direction where you want to lo
        Returns:
        the list of visible players

      • distance

        public static int distance(Player p1,
                           Player p2)
        Return the manhattan distance between two players
        Parameters:

        p2 - player 2
        Returns:
        the distance

      • playersAtGivenDistance

        public static java.util.List<Player> playersAtGivenDistance(Player pl,
                                                            Map map,
                                                            boolean mustVisible,
                                                            MapDistanceStrategy strategy)
        Return the list of players in distance (calculated by the MapDistanceStrategy) already removing the player who you start looking from
        Parameters:
        pl - Player from where you start looking
        map - Map
        mustVisible - true if the player needs to be visible
        strategy - strategy that accept/refuse an enemy
        Returns:
        The list of visible players accepted from the strategy

      • possibleMovements

        public static java.util.List<Point> possibleMovements(Point startPoint,
                                                      int dist,
                                                      Map map)
        Find the list of the points reachable at a maximum given distance
        Parameters:
        startPoint - start position
        dist - max dist to look for
        map - the map
        Returns:
        the list of points reachable with that amount of movements

      • possibleMovements

        private static java.util.Set<Cell> possibleMovements(Point startPoint,
                                                     int dist,
                                                     Map map,
                                                     java.util.Set<Cell> points)
        Find the list of the points reachable at a maximum given distance
        Parameters:
        startPoint - start position
        dist - max dist to look for
        map - the map
        points - the Set of points
        Returns:
        Set of cells to which the movement is possible

      • possibleMovementsAllSingleDirection

        public static java.util.List<Point> possibleMovementsAllSingleDirection(Point startPoint,
                                                                        int dist,
                                                                        Map map)
        Return the list of possible movements that are in a single direction, it looks for all the directions
        Parameters:
        startPoint - Point from which the movement starts
        dist - Maximum distance in number of steps
        map - Map on which the steps will be calculated
        Returns:
        List of possible destinations

      • possibleMovementsSpecificDirection

        private static java.util.List<Point> possibleMovementsSpecificDirection(Point startPoint,
                                                                        int dist,
                                                                        Map map,
                                                                        Direction dir)
        Return the list of possible movements that are in a single direction, it looks for a specific direction
        Parameters:
        startPoint - Point from which the movement starts
        dist - Maximum distance in number of steps
        map - Map on which the steps will be calculated
        dir - the direction where you want to look for
        Returns:
        List of possible destinations

      • nextPointSameDirection

        public static Point nextPointSameDirection(Point start,
                                           Point first)
        Find the second point in the same direction the first has been found from the start
        Parameters:
        start - start point
        first - first point found
        Returns:
        the second point in the same direction as the first

      • visiblePoints

        public static java.util.List<Point> visiblePoints(Point startPoint,
                                                  Map map,
                                                  int notVisDist)
        Return the list of points visible from the startPoint plus all the ones at a maximum distance from a visible one that is less than notVisDist
        Parameters:
        startPoint - starting point
        map - map where you need to look
        notVisDist - if 0 the method returns only visible points, otherwise it returns also points that has a notVisDist as max dist from a visible point
        Returns:
        List of possible destinations
